princ

Class Principal

  • java.lang.Object
    • princ.Principal

  • public class Principal
extends java.lang.Object
    Using the Jade's documentation, you can hardly find how to launch a platform from source code. I hope these few classes will be useful. You can decide in the main class with example you want to be executed example 1 : 1 main container, 3 containers, 4 agents Agent0 on container1 Agent1 and Agent3 on container2 Agent2 on container3 Agent0 will send one message to agent1 that's all :) example 2 : 1 main container, 3 containers, 2 agents AgentA and AgentSUM onf container2 AgentA will send 10 values to agentSUM, which will compute the sum and return the result to agentA In both examples, the "pause" when launching the platform is just here to give you the possibility to activate the sniffer agent from its GUI in order to sniff the agents and to graphically see the message passing process. In any case, I chose here to print the sent/received on the standard output. For sake of simplicity, the creation of the containers and of the agents is hardcoded, and I do not activate the sniffer by default. It is bad. Tested with Jade from 3.7 to 4.4.0
    Author:
    hc

        Create an empty platform composed of 1 main container and several containers.
        Parameters:
        containerList - the HashMap of (container's name,container's ref)
        Returns:
        a ref to the platform and update the containerList

      • createContainers

        private static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,jade.wrapper.ContainerController> createContainers(jade.core.Runtime rt)
        Create the containers used to hold the agents
        Parameters:
        rt - The reference to the main container
        Returns:
        an Hmap associating the name of a container and its object reference. note: there is a smarter way to find a container with its name, but we go straight to the goal here. Cf jade's doc.

      • createMonitoringAgents

        private static void createMonitoringAgents(jade.wrapper.ContainerController mc)
        create the monitoring agents (rma+sniffer) on the main-container given in parameter and launch them. - RMA agent's is used to control, debug and monitor the platform; - Sniffer agent is used to monitor communications
        Parameters:
        mc - the main-container's reference

      • createAgents

        private static java.util.List<jade.wrapper.AgentController> createAgents(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,jade.wrapper.ContainerController> containerList)
        Creates the agents and add them to the agentList. The agents are NOT started.
        Parameters:
        containerList - :Name and container's ref
        Returns:
        the agentList
